entry.title: Debit Cards for the Nomad Man

link.title: Debit Cards for the Nomad Man

entry.content:
Introduction

Cash is less and less used and the different technologies, the regulations and COVID-19 have all something to do with this. Although the future may not be necessarily in the hands of cards, which are a product that has barely evolved in the recent years, they are still the preferred paying method.

In this post, we are including the best cards that you can find in the market. When I mention the best, I’m referring to the best quality price relationship. Therefore, if you are looking for products such as the American Express Centurion or alike, you will have to wait.

Please note that due to the banking licenses and regulations, some of these cards may not be available in some countries. This is because I just recommend what I use, or I have used.

Revolut

Revolut is one of the most valuable FinTech in the world and the most valuable fintech in UK, where it is based. It’s also probably the most famous company in this list.

Aside debit cards, they also offer other financial products such as vaults, trading and crypto. However, nothing against these services, but I think there are much better options out there if for example you are thinking on trading stocks or crypto.

Revolut has been growing exponentially in the last years thanks to their inexistent or low fees, application design and associated benefits.

The most known characteristic of Revolut is that there are no currency conversion fees on card payments.

Nonetheless, on weekends, the exchange rate fee is increased. In any case, even if there are some fees on the weekends, the rate is favorable than more traditional services.

Besides, if you use premium, you have unlimited transfer of foreign currencies. If you are abroad, you can also withdraw money from ATMs, up to a certain limit for free.

These characteristics make Revolut the perfect card for travelling and short stays in foreign countries. Furthermore, there were some great news at the end of 2021 since Revolut was granted the full banking license by the European Central Bank.

There are some options (Premium, Metal) for which the service will not be free and depending on your situation, it may be worth to check these. For example, if you transfer every month considerable amounts of foreign currency, it may be important to upgrade. At least on my case, this is more beneficial.

Revolut Business case

The most obvious case is for travelling to foreign countries, but there are many more usages.

Compared to other banks, one of the things I like most about Revolut is the instant transfer of money. If I transfer to my other accounts, the money is there in milliseconds. The other situation relevant on my case is to transfer different currencies. For example, if you can just deposit USD in your broker (e.g., crypto), this is a way method to transfer your local currency into USD without hidden fees.

Revolut Features

  • Nice design of the app
  • No currency conversion fees (except weekends) in transfers and card payments
  • Immediate transfers without fees
  • Excellent security management
  • Different partnerships for cash back
  • Getting more and more banking license (e.g., EU license)

In case you would like to open an account, you can open it from this link. You will receive a reward of 70 in your local currency when opening it with this link and following some steps: 70 Referral

The usage of the real exchange rates is one of the most notories features of Revolut.

N26

The origin of the name comes from the number of smaller cubes in a Rubik’s cube. Founded in 2013 in Munich, N26 is a German neobank with a huge customer base in Europe and the US.

N26 offers a basic account and a debit card in the entry level. For these products, there are no fees. The customer can add more services (N26 You and N26 Metal) if needed and for these ones, there will be a monthly fee.

If you want to open the account, the registration will take around 10 minutes.

ATM withdrawals are also free up to a certain amount per month.

They will also send the card for free when you top up your account for the first time. In most countries you can also use your mobile to pay since it is compatible with Apple Pay and Google Pay.

In the case of exchange rates, there rate may be slightly worse than the ones from Revolut. However, the conversion is constant on all days of the week. For foreign currency transfers, they are since a few months with Wise.

N26 Business case

In my case, I use it as a daily card in Europe. One trick I use is the following one. DAZN is a streaming service from Germany and available in many locations. However, the offering of DAZN Germany is much better than the one for other countries. For that reason, I have an account in DAZN Germany and I use my N26 to pay with it, since they detect that it is a German bank.

N26 Features

  • Great app
  • No currency conversion fees card
  • Cheap foreign currency transfers
  • Good security management
  • EU banking license
  • Since it is a German account, you may use it to access services in Germany (e.g., DAZN DE offers)

At the moment, there is no current promotion, but you may open an account from their website.

N26 is one of the application that has grown considerably in Europe.

Neon

The last one in the list is a Swiss digital bank, and it is just restricted to people living in Switzerland. Neon offers a bank, a phone application, and a debit card. Everything for free. Apart from not having any expenses, you can also have up to two ATM withdrawals per month.

Neon is also compatible with Apple Pay and Google Play. On top of this, Neon is also compatible with TWINT (if you are in Switzerland, you know what this is).

Although Neon does not have a banking license the Hypothekarbank Lenzburg manages the different accounts. For that reason, under the Swiss Banking Law, the deposited is insured up to 100,000 CHF.

If you are abroad, you don’t pay exchange rate fees in card transactions. On the other hand, for cash withdrawals in foreign currency, there is a 1.5% fee.

Neon also offers a more premium account, which is called Neon Green. The features of Neon Green are not focused mainly on the customer, but the society. For each Neon Green user, Neon plants 35trees every month. Further, for every 100 CHF spent, an additional tree is planted. For example, if you spend 4,000 CHF, they will plan 45 trees in one single month.

On top of that, you also have an extended warranty of 3 years, thanks that they have a partnership with hanks to our partner, Europäische Reiseversicherung (ERV) . All this is just for 5 CHF, which makes is quite reasonable.

Please note that even the registration process takes 10 minutes, you will need to show residency permit (e.g., if you just arrived in Switzerland).

Neon Business case

In my case, if you have Neon Green, you get a 3-year warranty extension for all electronic and electrical products. You always have two-year warrant for your products, so this means that you will have a total warranty of 5 years. Despite the different technological breakthroughs, planned obsolescence is at the order of the day. This way, we are more than covered.

Neon Features

  • Beautiful app
  • Integration with mobile payments
  • No exchange rate fees
  • Cheap foreign currency transfers
  • Neon green
  • Integration with TWINT.

You can download neon via this link. If you want to start with 20 CHF, you can use code LTM55N when you register.

If you live in Switzerland, Neon is a must for you.

Conclusion

In all these cases, for the basic service (account and debit card), there are no monthly fees or any disadvantage for using them. In my case I have all of these, but you can of course select just the one that suits you best. In case of emergency card, it is always a possibility to have others.

Please note that the promotions may vary from time to time and the amounts may also be bigger or lower. In all cases, if any reward, you and I get the same amount. However, the purpose of this article is just showing different advantages and help people move away from other banks with abusive fees and less benefits.
entry.summary: Multiple debit cards that you can use for free for multiple purposes: foreign currency, transfers, travels, stays abrod, etc.

entry.title: Education as the Best Investment
entry.content:
Introduction

I strongly believe, as some famous people have said, that investing in yourself is the best choice you can make in order to learn new skills and overcome your weaknesses.

Nowadays we are seeing a surge of online platforms and definitely users have more chances of learning something new and applying these skills. The times of having to go to physical classes is hopefully over.

Learning doesn’t necessarily mean studying or joining some classes. You can certainly learn new skills by listening, reading or observing how other people act.

Nonetheless, we are leaving these last actions for another post and in this article I’m introducing different courses that could be beneficial in your future.

Corporate finance – IESE Business School

I remember this was my first course at Coursera. I had also no clue about the finance world, and it opened many doors in future years. It is also the only course I have taken more than once since I really liked it how the teacher, Javier Estrada, explained the different topics clearly.

In this course you will understand how companies are financed to run their business and projects, how the interact with different actors of the global financial markets, and different formulas, etc. All in all, after course you will understand almost every topic you read in the financial news.

For some years, there was a huge demand to have Part II of the course and I saw it few months ago that there is indeed a second part. It is also part of the specialization Think like a CFO, which includes other 2 courses that are detailed better in the sections below.

You can find access to the single course or the specialization below.

Corporate Finance Essentials

Think like a CFO

Investment Management – University of Geneva

The investment management course is provided by the University of Geneva in collaboration with UBS. The specialization is composed of 4 courses, focusing on different finance topics. It starts with an explanation of how financial markets work, portfolio allocation, psychological topics that may impact our decisions

You will finalize the courses seeing other topics such as risk management, and new trends such as ESG, HFT or Robo-Advisors.

It is also interesting to see some real cases that occurred in the past, such as the Black Monday. It will conclude with a capstone project where you must define the portfolio of one of your clients.

If you are interested on switching to finance in your career, I would say that this is one of the best courses that you could start.

Investment Management

Foundations of Management – IESE Business School

I remember taking this course around the time I was promoted to Manager in a consulting company . As the title says, the specialization focuses on 4 pillars of corporate management and it is not entirely focused on finance. The 4 components that are taught in this MOC are:

  • Accounting
  • Finance For Managers
  • Marketing
  • Organizational Behavior

The first two courses are related to financial topics and how to understand the figures of companies, which is one of the most important things to make sure that they can work. These are also part of the CFO specialization mentioned before.

The last 2, are related to marketing strategies and management of people within the organization. Although they are not 100% related to finance, it is quite likely that they will play an important role future career.

Analysis of Business Problems. In this last course and it is a capstone project. There you will apply all the skills that you learnt with a real case from some years ago and the GasGas enduro and motocross brand.

You can find the 5 courses described above in the following link.

Foundations of Management

Financial Markets – Yale University

The last course in this list is probably the most famous one. If not, the teacher is probably you may have heard of because he is nothing less than the Nobel prize winner Robert Schiller.

Whereas the previous ones were specializations, this one is just a single course. However, it is longer than a usual course and it is divided into 7 weeks.

The purpose of the course is to go through almost every possible topic to understand the whole finance picture. Every week, there is a different topic and the ones below are the most important ones that are explained by Robert.

Corporate finance, insurance, different securities, bubbles, recessions, mortgage crisis (e.g., Case–Shiller index, derivatives, investment banking, brokers or new innovations in the future are some of the topics that you will observe in the series of lessons.

You can find more information about this below:

Financial Markets

Conclusion

Nowadays, unfortunately for most courses you have to pay. However, if not mistaken, the one from Robert Shiller is still free. In any case, any of the 4 courses or specializations is totally worth it and you also have the choice of trying those for 7 days for free.

There are some topics to investigate in these links and I do not want to overwhelm you with too many courses at once. In a few weeks, I will introduce other courses that may help you in your professional future, but not necessarily linked to finance (or yes). In these cases, all of them are from Coursera, but in the future articles I will try to present other platforms.

In the meantime, happy learning!
entry.summary: Different finance courses that can be a triggering point in your professional future

entry.title: Best Skin Products for Men - Part I

link.title: Best Skin Products for Men - Part I

entry.content:
Introduction

There are different daily routines that every person should do when waking up . Although it is normal taking a shower is the first thing we do when we get up, it is also common knowledge that we don’t pay attention to other aspects of our body such as the face. The same applies in the evening when we should clean our face. In this article, I’m explaining the different steps and a recommended product in order to improve our skin health and look younger.

I’m also recommending some products that may help you with this. Please note that depending on your skin type, it may be better to choose a different product. For thaese cases, I will also recommend other products in the upcoming articles related to this post.

It should be clear that I’m just mentioning some steps and for example the topics and applications of essence, Retin A or sunscreen are not included in this post.

At the end of each section, I will include a link where you can get these products with the guaranteed lowest price. However, please feel free to try other products or get them somewhere else.

Cleansing Gel

We start with a refreshing cleanser in order to remove all the accumulated dirtiness, excess of oil and impurities. This product will also revitalize our skin and make it calm, soft and relaxed.

After applying it, you can rinse it and you are ready to go to the next step.

Product

Idealove, A Dream Come True, Low pH Mystical Cleansing Gel, 5.07 fl oz (150 ml)

Toner

The purpose of the toner is to hydrate the skin and to remove the dead cells. It also acts as the base for the next products that are applied into our face. The toner should refresh your skin and don’t create any irritation or issue on it.

Product

Haruharu, Wonder, Black Rice Hyaluronic Toner, 5.1 fl oz (150 ml)

Serum

Serums contain countless number of active components and there are so many for each face and skin types that we could write several articles to discuss about them. They contain high amount of ntioxidants or peptides that penetrate your skin (after having applied the toner)

In this post, I’m just introducing one with hyaluronic acid, but in further posts you will see me recommending a different one.

There is no shortage of them, so I will be discussing other brands soon.

Product

Artnaturals, Hyaluronic Serum, 0.33 fl oz (10 ml)

Moisturizer

Once we have completed the steps above, we include the final touch with the moisturizer. The moisturizer’s goal is to help fight against usual suspects such as dryness or acne. The final objective is that after having applied all these steps your skin looks healthy, happy and great.

As in the other cases, every person has a different skin type. Therefore, please check the guidelines and consider the different recommendations.

Product

Acure, The Essentials, Moroccan Argan Oil, 1 fl oz (30 ml)

Exfoliation

I have left the exfoliation for the last part, although it should be applied just after the cleanser. The reason is that you should not exfoliate your skin every day-

There are many exfoliating types such as physical or chemical. In this case we are focusing on the physical face scrubs. Via the exfoliation we remove dead cells and we clean our skin. However, the process is more aggressive than the steps we described above. For that reason, it should not be used more than 3-4 times a week and depending on your skin type it may be even not recommended doing that more than twice a week.

Product

Acure, Brightening Facial Scrub, 4 fl oz (118 ml)

Conclusion

Following these methods will make that you skin younger and replenished, removing some years.

Furthermore, after following the different steps, you will feel refreshed and ready for a new day.

The products are selected on the utmost care, but please do your own research. Every person and every skin are different.

As discussed, the products may be available in different places. However, I have been always found cheaper at iHerb. The purpose of the article is not sharing any referral code, but in case this helps. You may find some discounts using the code below:

https://iherb.co/8tsMMkC

In next articles, I will include new products related to this process or additional steps such as chemical exfoliation or the sunscreen to apply-

entry.title: Shops for the Modern Man - Part I

link.title: Shops for the Modern Man - Part I

entry.content:
Introduction

In this article we are changing completely the topic, and we are introducing 4 online shops where modern men can go for shopping and find the next essential item for their daily activities.

The shops listed here have been included since they are international, and they should be accessible to all or most visitors around the world.  They have been on business for several years and apart from the quality, you should always expect a top-notch customer service.

The list has been prepared with the utmost care based on my experience after so many years of shopping in these stores.

Mr Porter

We start the list with a company that was created from to the Net a Porter group, focused on the men apparel. Some years ago, the Net-a-Porter group merged with Yoox and that’s why you will see in this page some articles that were available at Mr Porter in previous seasons.

Mr Porter is an online retailer for men fashion. Since the need to put emphasis on the digital world, the application and the website are top quality. They have multiple brands of the most recognizable brands in the world and every year they add new brands (whether they are newcomers to the industry or old players).

Since a few years, they have their own brand: Mr Porter which offers a good quality for the price. Needless to say, that the designs and quality are of the same standards of the other brands listed in this site.

Both website and application offer an outstanding experience

Key topics

The most important things to pay attention to for me are:

The exclusive collections just available at Mr Porter. Some of them in the past are.

  • Ermenegildo Zegna for Fear of God
  • Brunello Cuccinelli x Mr Porter
  • Kingsman, (yes, the ones from the film)
  • Tom Ford x Mr Porter

Despite starting with a few brands, the portfolio of brands and categories is today countless: shoes, bags, art, watches, or sports are other things that you will see in this store.

There is a section called “The Journal” which is also interesting, introducing other lifestyle topics such as cities or restaurants. What I also like is to receive the news about what’s new every week.

The sale season starting end of December and June is one of the most waited periods of the year for many people.  In this period, you can have huge discounts on the most reputable brands of the world.

Uniqlo

We continue with a Japanese which is very famous in this country, but maybe not that much in other regions of the world. Nonetheless, with their current expansion plans, it may not take long until you hear it about Uniqlo more often.

The retailer from Yamaguchi was founded in 1984 and their focus is on clothes that are basic, functional, have good quality, beauty and they have a fair price. On top of these characteristics, they offer good quality and affordable prices. Who wants more?

The designs you will see in this shop (for men and women) are for that reason not innovative in terms of fashion, but they will be modern classics that will last long in terms of quality and design.

Apart from these two attributes, they also combine beauty and collaborate with other top designers

Key topics

Apart from the essentials, which offer an excellent price quality relation, one of the other remarkable characteristics from Uniqlo are the collaborations they have at almost every time of the year. They collaborate with different artists and brands.

Some of the most remarkable collections and collaboration are:

  • Heattech (Specific technology for cold temperatures)
  • Uniqlo x JW Anderson
  • J+ (Jil Sander)

If you a have a store close to you, it may worth checking it. They have some promotions, where you may receive some free articles and you will have to rate them and publish a review.

Massimo Dutti

We leave two Spanish brands for the final part of this article. Although the name could indicate that the company is Italian, this is not the case. The brand from Arteixo is one of my favorites when it comes to quality and price. Although the products are made in different parts of the world, it is not strange to see clothes and accessories made in Spain, Portugal or even Italy.

Compared to the sister brands such as Zara, it offers a more classic style, higher quality and the prices are just slightly more expensive than the other fast-fashion brands.

Massimo Dutti is synonymous of a classic sophisticated style

Key topics

  • Limited edition: Around September and April, you may see special limited edition collections with nice designs.
  • Personal Tailoring: Since several years, Massimo Dutti has been offering a special service focused on suits and tailoring. The quality of the suits and shirts is above their “normal” ones, and I would suggest going for this option.

In terms of leather items, they are also very good such as bags and other wallets or mobile cases. In terms of sale season, although the price is already quite affordable, you may also see some aggressive discounts too.

Meermin

Since we are talking about leather items, we stay in Spain, but we close our journey to the Mediterranean Sea. More specifically. we stay in the town of Inca in Mallorca.

This online shop is not about clothes, but shoes. You will be different classic shoes such as: oxford, brogues, boots or buckles at very good price ranges.

MTO groups are an original idea from Meermin

Key topics

Apart from the quality and prices, something I really like are the MTO (Mate to Order) groups.

For a specific period, there are some specific models available. These shoes will be unique because they will not be available again. The process is based on the crowdfunding model for which the customers decide which shoe model is produced. In order to fund the shoes, the 100% of the goal must be reached.

Please note that since the prices are already too competitive. It is not common that you will see sales or special orders here, as in the previous three stores we described above.

If you prefer to try the shoes physically, there a few stores in the word: Madrid, Paris, and New York. Otherwise, they send order to almost every part of the world.

With these 4 stores we conclude today’s story. However, it will not take long until I present you another 4 stores I use and buy from.
entry.summary: 4 online shops to find the next essential item. The shops included here are Mr Porter, Uniqlo, Massimo Dutti and Meermin.

entry.title: DeFi: Anchor Protocol (20% APY)
entry.content:
Introduction

In the recent years, we have been suffering a 0% interest rate policy in our deposits. In some cases, this has been translated even into negative interest into some countries or abusive custody or management fees. I have been always not happy about this topic, since we are lending our money to the banks (in some cases charging us for that money) and with that money, they lend it to other customers, for which they charge an abusive interest rate.

Although in the past decades there has not been any breakthrough in traditional finance (I just think about ATMs and credit cards), for the past years a new concept known as DeFi has been introduced and it’s getting more traction. Every year, there are several projects related to it, mainly linked to blockchains and different crypto currencies.

The purpose of this article is not praising the different benefits of DeFi and criticising the traditional finance. The goal is just to show that there are more alternatives to depositing the money in the bank, giving us a 0% on it.

What's Anchor?

For that, I am showing those who are not aware of Anchor Protocol. What’s this? Anchor is a platform that offers both savings account and a lending platform.

In this article we are just focusing on the savings account, for which depositors get approximately an APY of 19.5%.

The deposits are in TerraUSD (UST) , which is the Terra stable coin. The value of this coin is pegged to the USD and there is a mechanism to make sure that the value keeps pegged to the UST. There are some interesting videos about this algorithm and other projects such as White Whale that use it to get extra APY on the arbitrage. You can find additional references in this link Useful links.

This means that with a deposit of 10,000 UST, we will get around 2,000 UST after one year. The UST is compounded daily and reflected in your deposit. For example, in one week, you get around 38 UST with the example above.

Please note that the APY slightly varies and it is likely the case that once there are several adopters of UST, the APY will reduced.

Anchor Protocol offers a flexible savings account with no minimum deposit and no commitment.

How to deposit into Anchor Protocol

We have said that the Anchor works with UST. You cannot deposit fiat or any other stable coins. Some months ago, it was more difficult to get UST. Fortunately, it is now more and more extended and there are more and more different options. The last exchange that listed UST was Kraken. In terms of fees, this may be also the most convenient one if you are living in Europe.

Before explaining briefly the different alternatives, you will need a Terra Station wallet. This wallet is the official one from TerraForm Labs and it’s used to manage the different Terra tokens (UST, LUNA, etc.)

There are some Chrome extensions and mobile applications for it. Once you have set it up, you will be able to send the UST (or LUNA) to your Terra Station address.

How to buy UST

There is an option to buy directly UST from Fiat in the Anchor protocol. The service is called Transact and it is displayed in the Anchor Protocol site. However, the conversion fees are quite high and there are cheaper options explained below.

Preparing the document, I have just seen that there is a new option (more and more exchanges are listing UST). This service is called Kado Ramp and the fee (2 UST) seems more affordable than Transakt.

Kraken

https://www.kraken.com/

Kraken is one of the most famous exchanges. In this case, the fiat deposit is free. You have options such as EUR and USD and you have pairs EUR/UST and USD/UST, meaning that you don’t have to convert to another coin to get UST.

The withdrawal fee to your Terra Station is 1 UST. The trading fees are quite low and the details are in the website. Expect around 1 UST per 1,000 EUR.

Binance

https://www.binance.com/

I cannot give my opinion about Binance US. The solution in Finance is depositing USD, and you get BUSD (the stable coin from Binance). This means that you are losing some part of the USD because the ratio is not exactly 1:1. Furthermore, you may also incur some transactions fees or exchange rate fees if your account currency is not quoted in USD.

From there, you can buy UST with BUSD. In this exchange, the withdrawal fee to the Terra Wallet is also 1 UST.

Coinbase

https://www.coinbase.com/

Please note that UST is also available in Coinbase, but this is not native UST and you cannot send it directly to Terra Station. You will need to convert it (e.g. using MetaMask) and this will incur high fees.

What you can do in Coinbase (Coinbase Pro for smaller fees) is either buying XLM (Stellar) or LTC (Litecoin) due to the low trading / transfer fees. You can send those to KuCoin and convert them to another stable coin such as USDT in order to convert them again to UST. The withdrawal fee in this case is 2 UST (it used to be 4 UST).

In Kucoin there are also SOL/UST pairs, so you could buy Solana in Coinbase and send it to KuCoin to the different transactions.

This option may be more expensive compared to the ones listed below.

Another option that exists is buying LUNA (TERRA) in any of the stock exchanges and sending it to your Terra Station. Terra Station has an option to swap LUNA / UST and the fee is 0.1%. This was the most convenient approach when UST was not listed in many exchanges.

What Anchor brings is a new concept for people tired of traditional banks and abusive rates. This is the crown of the jewell of the DeFi projects out there. Furthermore, this is a more conservative approach than buying crypto currencies, whose value fluctuates so much.

On the other hand, this is not a risk-free value and there may be some risks to be evaluated:

  • Smart contracts hack
  • Depeg of UST to USD
  • Losing the Wallet

My piece of advice is not putting all the eggs on the same nest, regardless of the reputation of the protocol or asset type. In the next weeks, I will introduce other DeFi protocols that could be interest to you.

Useful links

You may find additional information in the links below.

Anchor Protocol

You can read more about this in https://www.anchorprotocol.com/

Terra

You can read more about this in https://www.terra.money/

White Whale

You can read more about this in https://www.whitewhale.money/
entry.summary: This post introduces the benefits of Anchor Protocol, how to deposit UST, what is Terra and the risks and advantages related to this protocol.

entry.title: Best Emerging Countries for the Next Decade

link.title: Best Emerging Countries for the Next Decade

entry.content:
Introduction

The emerging markets had the worst decade since the 30’s in 2020 and 2021 was not much better compared to previous years. In 2022, we are seeing some minor improvements in these markets. But is there any hope for countries composing the emerging countries?

Here are some reasons to think that something is changing quietly to some of these markets or regions.

With the current interest rate policies from the ECB or the Federal Reserve, the currencies from the analyzed emerging countries are now more competitive compared to previous years. Further, they have avoided borrowing and increasing their national debt.

While western developed countries (US and Europe) are focused on conflicts, emerging countries have the time to focus on economy.

Apart from these common advantages, these are 5 of the emerging countries that will play an important role in the years to come.

Vietnam

An underdog and unknown by many in terms of financial markets, Vietnam is silently growing and leaving some analysts with the mouth open.

Not long ago, Vietnam was one of the poorest countries in the world. However, since the reform of the Đổi Mới in the 80s, the growth has been stellar and there are several reasons to believe that this growth will continue

With the recent Covid and other situations, Vietnam is one of the fastest growing countries. For example, in 2020, Vietnam’s economy was the best perform amongst all Asian countries. and its objective by 2045 is to be a high-income country. In order to achieve this objective, the population is expected to grow by 10% during this time, which will of course help with this goal

ETF to invest in Vietnam

https://etf.dws.com/en-lu/LU0322252924-ftse-vietnam-swap-ucits-etf-1c/

Vietnam has been one of the best-performer economies in the recent years and it is expected to grow further.

Philippines

By 2050, Philippines is expected to have a population of around 150 million. It is at that time, when it is expected that Philippines will be in the Top 15 economies of the world. Philippines did not grow much until the 21st century. However, the growth has been fast in the last two decades, focusing on the services sector. Due to these reasons, it has become one of the rising tigers in the Pacific region.

Some of the reasonings for this growth is that Philippines has a young workforce, the population speaks English and the household debt that is low compared to other countries in Asia and the rest of the world.

ETF to invest in Philippines

https://www.ishares.com/us/products/239675/ishares-msci-philippines-etf

Thailand

Not long ago, Thailand was in the list of undeveloped countries, as some of the countries listed in this article. However, since the 80’s, its economy grew almost at a rate of 10%. This was until the financial crisis of 1997-1998 and 2007-2008. Ever, since the growth has been not that high, but still acceptable and better than the ones of countries in this region.

One of the obstacles is that Thailand has a military government and the instability has been a negative factor during the 21st century. On the other hand, the strategic plan for the next years, called Thailand 4.0, has put emphasis on the transformation of the country into a more modern country by focusing on hi-tech companies and services. In this new era, the technology and the private sector will play an important role in the country’s digital transformation that will push and bolster the country’s economy.

Although the political instability, Thailand has a clear roadmap defined in Thailand 4.0

China

It should not be a surprise seeing China in this list. On the other hand, China was the second-worst performing emerging market in 2021. Some of the reasons are the regulations and isolation affecting some of the most important technology companies and other big conglomerates. The economic has grown more slowly in the past year, raising some alerts.

In the long term, one thing that is common knowledge is that the goal of China is to dominate the world economically. It is expected that China be the number 1 economy by 2030, overtaking USA. China may be facing some conflicts or obstacles that delay this forecast. However, China knows that they should remain prudent since they don’t want to be the new hegemony over a devastated world.

They have the potential to do so in the upcoming years. Furthermore, while other developed countries were struggling, they have been using different techniques in the recent years: investment in high-tech, R&D, purchase of debt from foreign countries, etc. There is no doubt China will be in the contenders list.

India

While different superpowers are engaged in different conflicts or crisis, the sleeping giant India remains silent.

With the economic policy changes introduced at the beginning of the 90s, India has been constantly growing every year. Furthermore, this growth is expected to continue at least for the next 20 years.

The growth is expected thanks to diverse factors such as population, urbanization, technology, private sector. For example, less than 10% of the companies are public. Another advantage compared to countries in this region is that India has inherited the British law system. This means, that regardless of the origin, all investors have the same rights - opposed for example to China -. 

Furthermore, although China is the most populated country today, there are some fertility issues in the Asian country. With this decrease in population in China and the increase in India, it is expected that India will be the most populated country in 30 years.

If the CEOs from the most important companies in the world are from Indian origin, why this cannot be replicated to the different companies in India?

entry.title: Achieving Economic Independence
entry.content:
Introduction

This is my first post in this blog, and I would like to address to a topic I may come back in the future to people without much time to analyse the different financial options for their future.

Nowadays, the future economic outcome is a constant headache for many people across several countries: inflation, economic recovery, pensions, etc.

There are many options out there for each type of investor: shares, bonds, real estate, crypto currencies, gold, etc. Each person has his preferences and depending on the age/risk-aversion different options can be multiple.

More sophisticated investors are not discovering anything new about this story. If you continue reading, I am focusing on what I think is the best for most people, with the least possible risk: the indexed funds or exchange-traded funds.

Passive funds: Index funds & Exchange Traded Fund

The behaviour for index funds and ETF is similar. Both replicate an index or basket of assets, meaning that with one single instrument you gain exposure to multiple securities (e.g., S&P 500 companies). Between those, the main difference is that ETFs are traded in real-time, whereas the funds are just redeemed at the end of the day. The fees for the ETFs tend to be slightly lower too. On the other hand, they are subject to transaction fees, but many brokers offer transactions on the most popular ETFs for free.

For a person without knowledge and looking for long-term returns, I am of the opinion of using a broad index and not a niche funds, which are focused a specific sector (e.g., eCommerce, video games, etc). Furthermore, although previous returns do not guarantee future returns, in the long-run most indexed funds outperform actively managed funds. The latter ones are famous for high fees, and although they may outperform passive funds in short periods, this is normally not the case in the long run. If you want to dig deeper, there are some formulas that determine the performance of the fund: For example: The Sharpe or Trentino ratio.

With the constant growth of fundd and the power of compounding you can get surprising results in the long run

Some examples

Depending on your risk-aversion, you may choose different funds depending on the allocation. People near the retirement age should be more conservative. The way to do in this case is focusing on bond funds, which are less risky than equities.

A famous rule is the “100 – age” rule. The result should be the amount of your portfolio invested on share funds. However, given the current situation, if you are young, there should not be problem on having a 100% equities asset location.

Below, there is a list with the most famous ones for different profiles.

SPDR® S&P 500® ETF Trust

Probably the most known ETF, which tracks the performance of the S&P 500 index. This is also the one with less expense ratio. It is considered one of the benchmarks.

https://www.ssga.com/us/en/intermediary/etfs/funds/spdr-sp-500-etf-trust-spy

Invesco QQQ Trust℠, Series 1

This ETF tracks the Nasdaq 100 index (non-financial companies) and it is riskier than the SPDR. Taking into account the returns from the past 15 years, it is the best performing large-cap growth funds.

https://www.invesco.com/qqq-etf/en/home.html

Vanguard Global Stock

This fund tracks the MSCI World Index (around 1,500 shares). Almost 70% of the exposure of the fund is in the United States with almost 70% of the fund. The second largest market is Japan with around 6%.

https://www.morningstar.es/es/funds/snapshot/snapshot.aspx?id=F0GBR04SKK

Vanguard Total Bond Market Index Fund Admiral Shares

For more conservative investors, we have this fund, which focuses on U.S. bonds (Treasuries and Mortgage-backed-securities). The returns are lower compared to the other 4 funds analyzed here, but it is also less risky.

https://investor.vanguard.com/mutual-funds/profile/VBTLX

iShares MSCI Emerging Markets ETF

This is an ETF tracking the equities from companies located in Emerging markets (China, Brazil, India, etc.) For that reason, the fund is considered riskier than those included above. Furthermore, the expense ratio is also higher in these funds tracking shares from emerging markets.

https://www.ishares.com/us/products/239637/ishares-msci-emerging-markets-etf

Please note that depending on the location, you may not be able to access some of these (e.g., most European investors do not have access to US funds). However, you should always be able to find similar funds to these.

Some of the ones listed above are ETF or index funds, but you may always find the equivalent depending on your preferences. In these cases, the expense ratio is considerably low. The more specific you go (e.g. specific sector) the higher the expense ratio tends to be .In my case, my preference is the ETF because the expense ratios are slightly cheaper and you can track the price as in the case of shares.

Today there are passive investment funds that replicate almost any available index or sector

Other details

The impact of currency

Although the USD has been dominating for many years, nobody knows when other contenders may appear. For the long-term, the recommendation would be to pick up an ETF or fund quoted in your local currency.

One-shot versus Dollar cost averaging

From my experience, the most dificult process is starting to invest, making sure that is it the right time. For this reason, although there are different studies showing that one-shot gives on average better results (time in the market beats timing the market), most people would not be comfortable dumping all the savings in one single transaction.

For that reason, the Dollar Cost Averaging is the preferred method for common investors. By using this method, whatever happens in the market, you buy every month the same amount of units/shares of the chosen fund.

Tax implications

The way you are taxed on the returns from investment funds may have a huge impact. The main difference is whether the fund/ETF is an accumulation or distributing investment vehicle.

In accumulation funds, the dividends received from the fund are reinvested. While this event is not seen as taxable for investors in many countries, it is seen as taxable for investors resident in countries such as Germany or Switzerland. Please consider that may be also other rules: For example, in Norway, the tax rate differs depending on whether the fund is an equity fund or a fixed-income fund. Therefore, please consider your situation in advance before choosing a specific fund.

Thus, depending on the country you may want to look at what options are best for you. Furthermore, there are some tax-savings accounts in some countries that may be useful to make sure that you get benefited from the best product-

Together with the expenses and commissions, taxes may be the most important factor eating your total returns. Imagine that you are paying 25% of tax in the dividends you receive. You are already not receiving this money, and more importantly, this amount is not used for the compounding, which reduced considerably the future value of the fund.

 

Where to start

Now that we have seen the theory, it is time to jump into the action. Depending on the location you may have just access just to some brokers. Here are some examples where you may start investing in some ETFs or investment funds.

  • Degiro - https://trader.degiro.nl/
  • Fidelity - https://www.fidelity.com/
    • Vanguard - https://investor.vanguard.com/investing/transaction-fees-commissions/etfs
  • Investment Brokers - https://www.interactivebrokers.com/es/home.php
  • eToro - https://www.etoro.com
  • Saxo Bank - https://www.home.saxo/
  • Charles Schwab - https://www.schwab.com/
  • MyInvestor - https://myinvestor.es/
  • Robinhood - https://robinhood.com/
  • Swissquote - https://en.swissquote.com/

As discussed above, some of them are just available on certain locations. However. You will certainly find one available

Resources

These are some of the books or that I have read and that I recommend if you would like to know more about this topic can be also found below:

  • The Bogleheads' Guidex to Investing by Taylor Larimore https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/381355

  • If You Can: How Millennials Can Get Rich Slowly by William J. Bernstein https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/21852252

  • The Psychology of Money by Morgan Housel https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/41881472

  • The Intelligent Investor by Benjamin Graham https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/106835
entry.summary: How to achieve financial independence without magic formulas. Via a simple process, you will have considerable returns in the long run.
